inn1.comm: full of a length and swinging back in towards middle stump straight away, Cook prods into the leg side
pitched up outside the line of off, curving back as Cook steps out and leaves
full and shaping back on off stump, it's gentle swing though and Cook is able to punch down the ground fine past mid-off for four
angled across, on a length and leaving Cook - that's wide
fuller length, again sprayed towards the slips ... but this time umpire Illingworth is happy enough
full and wide of off, Cook leans out and lets it through
length ball, tighter line but still safe enough for Cook to leave
tossed up outside off, Bell leans out to his first ball and drives one to long-off
nice drift across the left-hander, Cook feels for it outside off and the ball slides past the edge into de Villiers' gloves
length, down the leg side, nudged off the pads short and square
tossed up on leg stump, worked to midwicket coming forward
full, around the line of leg stump, Cook goes down on one knee and gets his sweep shot away through backward square leg for another four
pushed through a bit quicker, on off stump, defended on the front foot
overpitched on leg stump and Bell pings this through backward square leg with a flick of the wrists, drawing a snort of the nostrils from Steyn
length ball around the line of off stump, Bell gets behind it in defence
pitched up on the stumps and Bell drives back down the pitch, Steyn gets his fingertips on it and prevent the ball going a long way, with mid-on coming across to field
back of a length and wide of the stump, stays back and cuts one to the sweeper through point
a length ball fizzes past the outside edge as Cook fences from the crease
strays on the the pads again and Cook middles a back-foot glance through midwicket all the way to the rope
flighted, angled towards leg stump, played back to the bowler
full and on the stumps, driven back down the wicket and Peterson fields again
drags his length down as Bell advances, pushed into the covers
too short from Peterson, Bell goes deep in the crease and cuts late, it's briefly in the air but wide of slip and scoots away off the outfield
tossed up on the stumps and defended

sliding in with the arm and Bell is hit in front ... Dharmasena gives it but England review, which replays show was a poor decision, Bell played for turn that wasn't there and the ball went on past the bat, impact was inside the line and leg stump would have been rattled
back of a length wide of the stumps and steered down to third man
length, in the channel outside off, left alone

and now he's gone, second ball edged behind! England are immediately two down and you have to wonder about the logic of promoting Bopara on his current form. He simply pushed indeterminately at a ball he could have left and feathered through to de Villiers, a type of dismissal we've seen a couple of times previously in the series
back of a length, outside the line of off, Bairstow drops his bat out of the way
Steyn thinks he's got another, beating Bairstow's outside edge with a snorter, but there wasn't an edge
darts another length ball past the bat, tight line and Bairstow just played inside it
back of a length, dropped short into the off side and they scamper one
line drifts down the leg side, that's a wide
pitched up on the stump and whipped through midwicket ... that was the shot Bairstow was aiming for when Morkel bowled him on 95 at Lord's
length ball, coming in towards the stumps, pushed into the covers coming forward
pitched up wide of off stump, driven with an open bat face towards point
short ball and pulled flat and hard straight to forward square leg
on the stumps, gets behind the ball and defended back down the track
fullish length and wide of the wicket, Cook happy to let that through
short of a length and at the stumps, defended on the back foot
touch short again, angled across and Cook has to make a late adjustment to squeeze the ball to point
short ball stays low and Cook blocks into the leg side from in front of the stumps
full and on leg stump, whipped off the pads but straight to square leg
another ferocious lifter snarls its way past the outside edge as Cook hops back
back of a length, outside the line of off stump, stays back and steers square into the off side
pitched up outside off and driven square to point, who drives to stop
short but too much width here and Bairstow hits in front of square, almost a tennis swing on the back foot and the ball races away
opens the face and guides a length ball down to third man
round the wicket, back-of-a-length delivery, left alone outside off stump
short and at the batsman, Cook is quickly on to it and pulls over midwicket for his fourth boundary
short and dropped short on the off side for one
short of a length, on the stumps, played into the off side
length ball, turned off the pads in front of square leg
pitched up, not much swing evident now and Bairstow clips to midwicket
length ball skids through a touch low outside off stump as Bairstow plays back, can't his bat down in time

is that a drop? Steyn fizzed one back in off the pitch, Bairstow played a little loosely at it, got a thin inside edge and de Villiers plunged full-length to his left but it popped in and out of his hand. So, yes, technically it was a drop
short and outside the line of off, Cook lets it sail through
length and coming in, turns the ball behind square on the leg side
gets forward and pushes a length delivery into the covers
pitched up and driven square on the off side
length delivery, maybe takes the pace off it a touch, Bairstow seems to be through the shot early and the ball loops safe on the off side
short of a good length, goes back and defends down on to the pitch, it bounces a few inches past the stumps as Bairstow hops back to try and kick it away
starts over the wicket to Cook, tight line and this climbs through to the keeper outside off
edged, short of the keeper though, Cook trying to cut off the back foot and the ball dies quickly
goes back and cuts a wide delivery through the infield behind point
on leg stump, length ball and turned into a gap at midwicket, they think about two but the fielder in the deep makes good ground
touch short, on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on off the back foot
width again from Parnell and Cook slashes like Freddy Krueger through backward point for another boundary
tossed up outside off stump and played back to the bowler
full and on off stump, driven back to Elgar again
flighted on the stumps, worked down the pitch on the on side, Elgar gets across to field
tossed up and punched to mid-on on the full
tight line, full and on middle stump, defended into the leg side
finally a bit of width for Bairstow, who rocks back and chops one through point - good start from Elgar, though
short ball, wide of the stumps, tapped towards point
full length and angled across, gets forward and pushes into the covers
short and hooked slightly awkwardly over square leg, tried to roll the wrists but ended up getting a top edge, the ball bouncing short of the deep square fielder
length ball, drifting down the leg side, flicked round the corner for one

big lbw appeal from Parnell, Bairstow misses with a shot across the line, hit on the knee roll but probably pitched outside the line of leg stump. They get back for a couple of leg byes as the ball deflected behind square, though Cook has to hustle at the non-striker's end
defended on the back foot into the off side
tossed up outside the line of off, worked through the leg side
floated up on off stump, Bairstow walks out to the pitch and chips over midwicket for one
pushes this across outside off stump, quite wide and Cook stretches to slap through point for one
tossed up on off, Bairstow is quickly forward, angles the bat and paddles very fine for a couple  to long leg
full toss, chopped back to the bowler ... but Elgar had overstepped, no-ball
excellent way to deal with the free hit, a quicker ball, yorker length and Bairstow has to jam his bat down on it at the last minute
flighted on middle and leg, turned through midwicket with a flick of the wrists
back of a length, angled across towards off stump, played into the midwicket region off the back foot
short and a touch wide but Cook can't beat the infield with his back-foot hack
continues to dig it in short, stays back and plays towards mid-on
slightly fuller length, outside the line of off, driven to cover
pitched up, in the corridor outside off, Cook pokes at it and thick-edges low past slip for a couple as Amla fields at third man
on the stump, full length and punched to mid-on
full on leg stump, Bairstow misses with a sweep and gets struck on the pad
straighter and driven back to the bowler
middle and leg, nudged out to deep midwicket on the front foot
just outside off, full, ran back to the bowler
straighter and flicked through midwicket to the deep fielder
leg stump and this time the gap is found on the sweep, nicely played between square leg and the 45
length ball just outside off, Cook forward and blocking into the covers
leg stump, tucked through square leg
short and leg side
just outside off, guided down to third man
middle and off, Cook half-forward to defend to midwicket
similar line and similarly played but it comes off a big inside edge past the pads into the on side
short outside off and pulled but there too soon and missed
forward, played up to cover from just outside off
tried to go leg side I think but shovelled it down to mid on in the end
again ends up shovelling a full ball straight and it nearly produces a catch back to the bowler, he shelled it on the dive but it might have been a bump ball
swept from middle and leg to the deep fielder
down the wicket, Peterson holds it back and Bairstow is forced to defend
too leg side and tucked away for an easy single
length ball around off stump, played forward and blocked back up the wicket
full-ish and flicked back past the bowler, mistimed, it runs to mid on
outside off, cut into the ground to point
full ball, tried to go leg side, comes off high-ish on the bat back towards the bowler
short and pulled for four, seemed to take the bottom hand off the bat after playing it but it was timed to perfection and finds the gap behind square

clipped into the leg side and caught at deep square leg. Bad way to go really, he improvised, going across the stumps to flick over the leg side, it was timed pretty well but he picked out the fielder with a little flick with perfection
wide of off stump, went to cut a fairly fullish ball and missed
similar delivery but this time gets it past point
fuller and punched down to long on
forward outside off and blocked to cover

oh another one gone! Tried to go over mid on and mistimed it straight to mid on, poor dismissal, Hashim Amla bags the simple catch as Morgan stepped down the wicket, trying to find the long on rope but got it off the outer half of the bat I think and slapped it straight to the fielder
outside off, full and ran back to the bowler
full and blocked back to the bowler
just outside off, it was cut off a genuine edge and runs where fourth slip would have been down to the fine third man rope
straighter and tucked to midwicket staying in the crease
fuller just outside off, played to midwicket again
length again, back foot punch to cover
forward and blocked into the covers from just outside off
full just outside off, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up a little more, forward blocking again
tighter to middle stump, skids on a little, kept out into the leg side
very full, dug out on the crease
tossed up more, runs off the pads behind square on the leg side
down to sweep, meets it on the full, gets it out to square leg in the deep
full onto the off stump, punched back towards the bowler, runs off Kieswetter's boot into the leg side
short, goes to pull but only gets it to midwicket
length ball onto off stump, blocked in the crease
leg stump, fuller, whipped out between deep square leg and long leg
short outside off, clipped down to third man
sliding past the off stump, left alone
back of a length, pushed past extra cover and there's a misfield in fact so they take two
outside off, swept to deep square leg
forward and defending around off stump
Kieswetter removes the pressure of eight balls without scoring by moving down the track and clipping to long off
outside off, it slides on and is cut to deep point
fuller on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
sliding past the off stump, left alone
back of a length and clipped through square leg
back of a length ball dropped wide of midwicket
fuller just outside off, played into the covers
back of a length outside off, cut at and missed
middle and leg, forward to block

chipped back to the bowler and caught! Another very soft dismissal and now England in serious trouble, it was a low full toss that Cook went to punch back down the ground but spooned a low catch to the bowler who claimed it low, a sharp take and a bad way to go for another England batsman
leg stump full toss, flicked behind square on the leg side
back of a length, cut out to deep cover
this is much better, tossed up onto middle stump, ran back to the bowler
outside off and fiddled to backward point
wide of the off stump and left alone
back foot and pushed past point
another huge no-ball, low full toss carved to deep point
full ball and carved through cover, only a single
glorious this, full outside off and lavishly driven past extra cover, everything perfect about that
better now, length ball around off stump, blocked into the covers
short well outside off, threw the kitchen sink at it and got a bottom edge into the ground, missed out really
forward just outside off and played to mid off
played back and blocked back up the wicket
dragged down outside off and cracked past point, gets it to the fence
forward on off stump, played to cover
tossed up and a misfield at extra cover, single down to long off
tossed up onto middle and off, forward blocking
dragged down again but only pulled down to long on
forward just outside off stump, played into the covers
defended in identical fashion
length outside off, left alone
length ball, clipped to midwicket
slower ball just outside off, went to run it down to third man but gets in on the bounce to the keeper
forward outside off, angled towards cover
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped into the on side
down the track and clipped down towards long off, good stroke but just a single
tucked down the ground again playing forward
taken off middle and off through midwicket
tossed up and ran down the ground again
using the feet again, slapped down the ground, long on cuts it off
length ball, defended solidly in front of off stump
touch wider, good length delivery, pushed into the off side

slower bouncer and Patel has been duped, gloving through to the keeper! The ball sat up, hovered in front of the batsman's eyeline and he tried to fiddle it round the corner only to get a faint fist-bump through to de Villiers
short and wide, seaming away further as Woakes dangles his bat out
another back-of-a-length delivery outside off, this time he draws the bat out of the way
gets in line to defend a length ball in front of off stump - wicket maiden from Steyn. He's bowled mighty fine today
short ball, sits up nicely and Kieswetter steps back to cream and short-arm jab through midwicket for his second boundary
on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
pushed through, flatter delivery on leg stump, tapped through square leg
flighted outside the line of off, pushed towards cover
defended in front of off stump
full and looping leg-stump delivery, shuffles around and clips one to long leg - that'll be drinks. Up here in the comms box, we'll just do a few star jumps
full and flighted on the stumps, grips and Woakes doesn't get it out of the middle but they take one to long-on
on the stumps, pushed into the off side
pushed towards leg stump, tries to flick into the on side, hit on the pad
tossed up, driven back to the bowler on the front foot
goes back and turns a length ball to square leg
tossed up, advances but is hit on the pad trying to work to leg
round the wicket, angled across on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
touch shorter, on the stumps, flicked through the leg side
full and on middle and leg, leans out and pushes back to the bowler
tossed up on off stump, leaves the crease the punch down the ground to long-on
shorter length, goes back and turns the ball through square leg
pushed across, cuts with a windmill of the arms but Parnell makes a good stop at backward point
pushed through outside the line of off, tapped through point
tossed up on off, driven to extra-cover
drifting in with the arm towards middle and leg, worked through square on the leg side
length ball on the stumps, Kieswetter rotates the wrists to flick one out to deep midwicket
punched back at the bowler, it stays in the air and slips just out of reach as Peterson dives to his left, they get one to long-off
pushed through in the channel, tapped to point
full and well outside the line of off, Kieswetter smears this over cover and away for four
tighter line, length delivery in the corridor, lets it through
angled in and holding its line on a good length, opens the face and steers one to third man
bumper, well-directed and Woakes drops his hands, jerks his head out of the way
length ball, coming back in towards off, pushed to extra-cover on the front foot
another good bouncer and Woakes pulls, gets a solid top-edge connection and it flies over ABdV for four - moral victory for Morkel; runs for Woakes
short of a length, angled across wide of the stumps, cut through backward point
probing line, pushed across the right-hander and beating the outside edge
tighter to off stump, stays back and defends into the off side
another streaky bacon four for Woakes, he had a real go at a short ball outside off, thick-edging over Smith at first slip
full length and pushed wide of off stump, driven behind square
pitched up around the line of off stump, jabbed into the off side
full and in the corridor, plants the front foot and drives to extra-cover
full length again and scooped over cover for one to the sweeper on the bounce

slogged and gone, straight up in the air and caught at mid-off! Kieswetter was maybe fooled by a slower ball there, went to drive down the ground and hold the pose but was left staring at the ground as the ball soared up and down into the safe hands of Amla
short and in the channel, Woakes lets it through
length ball on the stumps, turned through deep backward square
bouncer, rearing at the throat, Tredwell plays it down into the off side
tossed up and played back to the bowler
shorter length, on the pads and flipped through the leg side
looping offbreak, bit of drift in towards off stump from round the wicket, pushed back wide of the bowler and Duminy fields
angled in with the arm, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
full and on off stump, forward defensive
short and wide and cut behind point, Amla throws himself to make the stop but they get one
length ball, speared across and pushed into the covers on the front foot
opens the face and steers a length ball towards point on the front foot
dug in short, Tredwell goes back and drops short on the leg side, they trot a quick one
short and at the man, Woakes plays this very well, flicking it off the hips down to the vacant long leg boundary
back of a length, on the legs again and flicked through square
Tredwell happy to let a length ball go through outside off
worked off leg stump through midwicket
forward just outside off, dropped towards point, they consider a single and think against it
angled towards the pads, strikes the front protector as Tredwell looked to clip it away
short to cut, missed and it doesn't evade off stump by much
sharp single into the off side, direct hit would have been gone, it was sharp work but he missed
dragged down, paddle swept behind square on the leg side for just a single
pushed wide of the bowler having come down the wicket, single to long off
length ball moved through midwicket
tossed up and punched back towards the bowler
waited for and tucked through square leg
flicked to midwicket from outside off
this time taken inside midwicket so they can take the single
length outside off, left alone
back of a length, cut down to third man
length ball, moving away, slower ball too, followed it and couldn't run it down to third man
flash outside off and missed
patiently pushed to point
length just outside off and finally Woakes is able to nudge it past the fielders, this runs to third man
down the wicket and worked to long off

nicely flighted this, Tredwell is done and gets bowled. No where near the pitch of the ball and swings across it to be bowled middle stump. Really well bowled from Peterson, tossed up and Tredwell was done, completely misread it

what on earth, first ball, straight up in the air and caught. Goodness me that is an awful shot, skied it straight up first ball an absolute shocker from Anderson, tried to find the pavilion to a ball that was again tossed up and floated nicely, two in two deceiving the batsman in the flight
floated up again, onto leg stump this time, off bat and pad behind square on the leg side
dance down and clip to long off
leg stump again, clipped through square leg
length and a play and miss just outside off, miles away from it
better, on the stumps, but Dernbach keeps it out to cover
fuller, just outside off, an attempted off drive misses by a long way again
it's towards the stumps, flicked in the air slightly but wide of mid on and they take a run
width outside off, cut down to third man where Morkel slips...and just about reaches out to save four, that was very well saved in the end
short and paddled down to long leg
pulled square of the wicket on the leg side
caught behind and that ends a pretty poor effort from England. A short ball, Dernbach goes to pull and nicks behind, done for pace and a thin edge goes through to the keeper at shoulder height

inn2.comm: pitched up and punched from in front of off stump to mid-off
overpitched on leg stump and whipped remorselessly past midwicket for the first boundary of the innings
too straight, worked off the pads through square leg for a couple into the deep
length ball, angling in on middle and off, pushed wide of mid-on for one
full and wide of the stumps, Smith gets half forward and punches to mid-off
pitched up outside off stump, closes the face and nurdles on to mid-on
speared across, touch short of a length and climbing past the outside edge off the pitch as Smith fends
length ball, wide of the stumps and lets this one through
wide, dragging Smith across, tries to cut but bottom edges on to the square

fired across the bows, loose shot and edges to slip! Tredwell juggles but this time clings on! England's plan of trying to pull Smith into his discomfort zone outside off has only had sporadic success but this time the frustration results in a big, breezy waft and a thick, thick edge
back of a length outside off, stays back and defends into the off side
full and straight this time, du Plessis transfers his weight forward and clips the ball into an empty part of the field through midwicket
length ball in the corridor outside off, hops back and shoulders arms
pitched up outside the line of off stump, gets forward and blocks to cover

gone, two down! A snorter, pitches in line and leaves du Plessis and he nicks off! That was a brute of a ball, on a good length and the batsman stayed back, played inside the line and it kissed the edge high up the bat before soaring through into Kieswetter's gloves
length ball, curving back in and Elgar defends, gets and inside edge and ends up catching the ball between his legs. Ooh er
gets forward and defends a full length ball into the on side
slides this past the outside edge, length ball and pushed across, Elgar fiddles uncertainly and Trent Bridge roars afresh
back of a length on leg stump, Amla misses trying to flick to leg and is hit on the thigh pad
full and wide of off - too wide for Amla, too wide for the umpire
tighter line, shaping gently in and out, Amla steps outside the line and leaves
back of a length at the man, Amla tucks it into the leg side
touch short of a good length, on leg stump, blocked back to the bowler
pushed across on a good length, leaves the batsman and Elgar stays in the crease, draws his bat out of the way
dug in short of a length, on the hips and glanced to long leg
line and length, seaming across the left-hander, Elgar pushes forward and is beaten outside off
another teaser, pitched in line and angled across, Elgar stays back and fences, misses again
wider line, full and tempting but Elgar is happy to leave

he's got bat on this one and has to go, caught behind! Anderson kept probing outside off and Elgar's green colouring was as much down to seasickness as his South Africa kit - he could have left on length probably but pushed, nicked and had to walk
pitched up in the corridor and draws de Villiers forward, hesitant play and a miss first ball
tight line on off, full of a length and punched to mid-off - that's a second consecutive wicket-maiden for Anderson
on the stumps, drifting towards leg and a touch short, flicked to long leg
lovely shot from de Villiers to get off the mark, given a bit of width and he punches a back-foot drive away square
touch short, outside off, stays back and taps to point
length ball, aimed at the top of off stump, gets across and blocks into the leg side
good length delivery seaming in towards the stumps, again chopped away defensively
slower ball, out of the back of the hand, pops up off the surface and takes the shoulder of the bat, looping short on the off side
length ball outside off, doesn't deviate off the pitch and steered with an open face to third man
touch full and ducking back in, de Villiers plays away from his front pad and gets an inside edge to backward square leg, "oohs" and "aahs" in the stands as they sneak a tight single
stays back and dabs towards point, misfield from Morgan means they get another
pitched up on off and sweetly timed back down the ground for four to long-on, bottom hand off the bat in the follow through - perfick
teaser in the channel, rears up off the pitch, de Villiers thinks about playing at it before pulling his bat out of the way
back of a length and defended down on to the pitch ... in fact, it bounces right back up to saying hello, bopping ABdV lightly on the grill
slides his line down the leg side, worked unfussily through backward square
full and angling in towards off stump, pushed back to the bowler
dug in but that's not the most threatening bouncer de Villiers has ever faced and he steadies himself to whip a pull shot through square
similar delivery, similar result, Dernbach dropping short and de Villiers putting him away dismissively  through midwicket this time
length ball on off stump, gets forward and pushes to cover
slower ball, well directed and blocked in front of off
good length ball, around the line of off, worked to midwicket on the front foot
tight line, the ball ducking in towards off stump, de Villiers gets behind it and turns to leg
dug in short, Amla rides the delivery and drops it into the off side for another quick one
allows one through outside off, length ball, keeps a bit low, no stroke
persists on that corridor-bothering line outside off, de Villiers again watches it through
pitched up outside off, holding its line off the surface, de Villiers gets a big step forward and shoulders arms
short delivery to start off with, Amla rocks-and-rolls the wrists through a lazy pull to deep backward square
pitched up on leg stump, clipped through square leg
length ball, still a touch too straight and glanced into the leg side
full and on off stump, not quite yorker length, blocked into the off side
length delivery, on the stumps, Amla stays back and tucks the ball to midwicket
pitched up on the stump, looking to sneak one through the gate, closes the face and works a single to deep backward square
full of a length outside off, blocked into the covers
touch wider, good length, Amla steps out and blocks square
short and a bit of width, Amla swings through a cut shot but Morgan plunges forward at point to field
length delivery in the channel outside off, opens the face and steers one to third man
line and length from Anderson, trying to sucker de Villiers, who gets a big step in and lifts his bat out of the way
this time gets across and defends a length ball into the off side - tight stuff from Anderson, just one off the over
back of a length outside off, defended
pitched up and Amla strokes a drive into the off side, unfortunately straight to cover
edged but it falls short! Amla played with Fairy soft hands, dropping the ball short of Kieswetter and Tredwell, and it then scuttled between them and away
length ball and Amla this time mistimes and drive short of mid-on, hits higher up the bat than he intended but lands safe
good comeback after the briefest moment of uncertainty, lashing a back-foot drive through cover
touch short and on the stumps, worked through backward square leg
tossed up on off, played with the spin to midwicket coming forward
full, outside the line of off, pushed towards cover
flighted on off, driven back to the bowler
spin for Tredwell, Amla playing back and the ball bouncing across, past leg stump and Kieswetter breaks the bails for good measure
spinning in from outside off, steps across again and this time manages to flick through backward square
tossed up outside off, de Villiers sweeps round the corner for one to long leg
pitched up outside off stump, gets forward and blocks
straighter line, touch short and defended into the leg side
on the stumps, turned past midwicket for one
touch short, angling in towards middle, nudged off the hips through square leg
length delivery outside the line of off, solid forward defensive
drops short and de Villiers murders a pull shot fine, it goes like a tracer bullet past the fielder at long leg for four
floated up on leg stump, clears the front leg and drives to long-off
flighted on middle and leg, straightening and defended back to the bowler
touch short, goes back and whips one out to deep midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, blocked
Amla advances and Patel drags his length down, pushed to mid-on
full and outside the line, Amla skips forward and drives forcefully through the covers, beating the man stationed on the rope
tossed up and clipped through midwicket
tried to be swept and struck on the pad
tossed up outside off, driven into the covers where Bell misfields
paddle swept for a single
tried to be chopped against the spin, skids on and comes off a bottom edge into the turf
waited for and flicked through square leg
skip down and drive to mid on who's on the edge of the circle
tossed up, played forward, off the inner half of the bat into the on side
pushed out to deep cover
too straight and worked out to deep backward square leg
floated up and driven elegantly through the covers to the sweeper
length ball tucked to mid on, they take a single, direct hit from Cook but de Villiers is well home
around the wicket, punched back to the bowler
length ball, clipped to midwicket
taken from outside off and dabbed behind square on the leg side
tossed up outside off and tucked through midwicket for a single this time
tossed up far enough outside off for Amla to through his arms at it, lifted over mid off, a lovely strike
full ball, worked to midwicket
oh first ball, fired into the pads, a huge, huge cry for lbw, no says Illingworth, England refuse the review and it's a good decision, Hawk eye had it missing leg
oh and this is very good, slips pas the outside edge with a bit of nibble, nice
too straight now though and tucked through midwicket
dabbed to point off a length, no run
worked down to deep backward square
nicely played, as late as was possible, guided to third man
tossed up outside off, paddle swept behind square to leg
reverse swept from around off stump to the 45 on the off side
unconvincing drive into the off side, reaches cover
reverse sweep again, strikes the pad outside off stump
back of a length, tucked to midwicket playing back
middle and leg, punched down the ground for an easy single to long on
full length just outside off, lovely flicked drive through cover
defended very late towards cover, they refuse the run
back foot punch to cover this time
length ball around off stump, again defended late on the crease
played slightly around the pad, worked through square leg
worked through a similar region
length ball around off stump, played up to mid off
slower ball, tickled down the leg side, saved by Kieswetter
hint of width and pushed to the deep cover
off drive, lofted for a time, but it's placed perfectly between mid off and extra cover, races away to the rope, well timed
and this is glorious, only a little movement coming forward to time a drive to perfection again, punched past the bowler, lovely stoke
and now just waits and guides to third man
guided down to third man with an angled face
pushed to mid on for a single
another glorious straight drive from de Villiers, that really is his shot, so graceful to watch that, just lent on it and timed it to absolutely perfection
leg side wide
length ball, a firm push to mid on
blocked into the covers to a length ball outside off
back of a length, worked through square leg
full, slower ball, tucked into midwicket
big bumper, too big and a wide
full and worked through square leg
sliding into the pads, off an inside edge off the pad to the leg side
slower delivery down leg and Kieswetter can't gather it either
full on off stump, cracked to extra cover, good shot, well saved
angled drive to cover point, a diving save
short outside off, angled down to third man
nicely bowled this, full length and it holds it line, beating Amla's outside edge
too straight and whipped out to deep square leg
angled down to third man to a length ball outside off
played via midwicket again to a fullish ball around middle and off
and now far too straight and a flicked four via square leg
tucked through cover with another easy nudge
forward to a ball just outside off, played into the covers
for some random reason de Villiers goes across his stumps to play to leg from off stump, gets a big leading edge over point, very fortunate and a totally unnecessary risk, easy AB
back foot punch out to deep cover
guide down to third man and...oh...Kieswetter lets it go, Bopara isn't looking and there's an overthrow, I think the floodlights got in the way
a beauty now, sliding past the outside edge, nip of back of a length, well bowled
very nice push down the ground, so well timed, Cook fields well at mid on
punched to mid off coming forward outside off
full and cracked out to deep cover
full and calmly taken through midwicket
up on his toes, clipping through point, they come back for two, excellent running...
another superbly timed shot down the ground but a fine sliding save from Bell at mid on, saved three runs
tucked through midwicket on the back foot
length ball blocked around off stump
blocked in a similar fashion
back foot punch through cover

awkward little push from outside off, comes off an inside edge onto pad, they call for a belated single and Woakes does brilliantly to race in, dive and throw the stumps down, but de Villiers is just back at the strikers end
played very late again, dropped through midwicket
played back to the bowler to a length ball just outside off
very full ball, dug out into the covers
good length, tucked back to the bowler
dropped down to third man
length again, worked into midwicket from the crease
stood tall and punched it into the covers
straight enough to work through midwicket on the front foot
length ball just outside off, punched past point, Anderson goes back towards the rope, he's limping a touch, hmm
similar ball, blocked back up the wicket
wide down the leg side
little bit of width so Amla times it wonderfully, half-saved by cover
forward and blocked back up the wicket
waited for and blocked in the crease into the leg side
full and squirted on the front foot past midwicket, it runs away from the fielder so they take two
pitched up outside off and driven to point
full and wide and driven through the extra-cover, the man on the rope runs round towards long-on and they get two
back of a length, on the stumps, ticked into the leg side
full and driven back to the bowler
length ball in the channel outside off, pushed through the off side
plays and misses at one that leaves him a touch outside off, nice delivery but no cigar for Bopara
round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, worked through midwicket
sliding across towards off stump, chopped through point on the back foot
tossed up on the stumps, turned through the leg side
flighted on middle, gets a leading edge back down the track
pick that out, Amla frees up the arms, clears the front leg and BOOMS a huge, lofted cover drive over the rope
short and wide of the wicket, pushed through the covers
pitched up on off stump, punched back to the bowler
slightly overpitched, off-stump line and smeared low through the covers for four
edged ... and that will be four, the ball sailing through the vacant first slip spot and away to the rope
slower legcutter, down the leg side and even though it comes back a touch, it's called wide
short and wide and thrashed through backward point for another four
pitched up on leg stump, misses with a flick to leg and the ball rolls away off the pad
effort ball from Dernbach, dug in short and Amla ducks
floated up outside off stump, reverse swept fine for four - AB isn't going to leg Hashim get ton up
dabbed fine on the leg side for one
tossed up and driven back to the bowler
flighted on off stump, goes back and across and tucks to square leg
beaten by the flight, trying to play across the line outside off, Kieswetter whips off the bails but even though they check the replays, the back foot remained in the crease
length ball outside off, tapped towards point for one
Dernbach bounces, Amla aways out of the way, the umpires look at each other - not a wide
full toss on off, punched to mid-off - it won't surprise you to hear that Amla will not be hurried

pitched up on middle and leg, Amla brings out the bottle opener and flicks off the cap with a clip through backward square leg for four - and that means South Africa win by seven wickets and tie the series 2-2
